comment: Just dont. She is rude and inconsistent. This class is way harder than it should be, she is a tough grader and pretty much wants to make everyone miserable.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The most disorganized professor I have ever taken. Due dates are always unclear, and she changes her mind every other day as to what she requires of you in assignments. Tests are open note, yet she requires a Lockdown browser which makes no sense as most everyone in the class has the textbook online. Unnecessarily tough grader in Discussion Boards.

She is the absolute worst professor I have ever had. She grades discussion post as if they are the end all be all. I have never had a worse professor. Whatever you do, DO NOT TAKE HER. I only took her because she was the last available professor for this course and I seriously regret not waiting another semester. She does not care.

This is by far the worst class I have ever taken. Professor Smith cares way too much about APA format on discussion posts rather than grading the actual material. she grades on things that aren't in the standards. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. you will regret that you chose it. If she wanted to be an English professor she should of been one.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is very harsh. Her feedback is helpful, but she doesnt give much room to slack off. Discussion posts are graded harshly and she is very apa heavy. If your citing is poor, your discussion grade will likely be poor as well. She also uses lockdown browser for quizzes/tests, which makes accessing online text impossible.

I have taken Mrs. Smith twice, once in person and once online. This semester, I decided to take her online Technology & Criminal Justice class (big mistake). First, she flat out told our class that she was only "monitoring" the class, so the lectures weren't even hers and for the first few modules we only had access to 10 mins. BE CAREFUL!

Regret taking this class. Worst professor I've had. Apparently not even our professor, only "monitoring"? Quizzed on questions we wouldn't have known because we didn't have access to the information. When made aware of this, she didn't even give us credit for those questions. Assigns so many articles to read each week. I have more to say but can't.

Very nice lady, takes the course way too serious in my opinion. The tests were very hard and difficult to study for. Make sure you attend classes for guest speakers, she gives credit for them. Stay on top of your work and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Participation matters

comment: Take Mrs. Smith she is a great teacher and brings tons of experience to the classroom. There are five test, couple little writing assignments. The test are from her lectures and the book. She offers extra credit at the end. Get to know her she possibly set me up with a job!

The WORST online teacher I've EVER encountered! She was NOT helpful any, whatsoever.. Her test and quiz were easy all semester as well as work load .. Just don't ask any questions and you'll be fine because she's RUDE!!

I really enjoyed this class. She is the best teacher!  She brought in guest speakers from the field and a make it very interesting.  For the record, she did tell us the reason for not recording.  It was class participation.  Other people don't want to be recorded.

First I'd like to say that I really enjoyed this class. I thought it would be an extremely boring class I actually enjoyed attending it even though attendance is not required. She made the material very easy to understand and kept me engaged throughout the course.

Didn't like this professor.  I never met a professor that would not allow recording of  lecture.When you ask her for her reasons you just get"Cause I said So".I asked her one more time thinking she might decide to respect me as adult and provide me with a good enough reason. Her response was the same.I recorded her lectures away. Just because Ican
Very engaging teacher but does not post power points. Must read chapters, type fast, or be able to keep up in the book to write notes later.

Attendance only required on test days, howeve must be in class for notes. Teaches from the book. Tests are worded tricky and must choose the MOST accurate. be careful. grading is fair. Syllabus description of case briefs are on point. enjoys being asked questions.

she with through notes so quickly i could barly write them down. She is very cool but would end class 15  minutes early and we had our test one day earlier so she could have our next class off...wasnt good for my style of learning. Went over notes like a review when its my first time learning this info. not good for me.
Great teacher and knows her stuff.  Also works in the field and sometimes have to miss class. Overall she will help you understand.

The greatest assess Ms. Smith brings to the classroom is her real life experience. She is always able to enhance the discussion through her experience from the field. She's an average instructor but her tests are pretty easy, since she gives you the essay questions and picks 4 out of 8. I would probably take her again.

Loved her! She is friendly and caring always there for help when you need it. She really listens and wants your feedback for the class and her lectures are clear and test are not confusing if you pay attention. Really enjoyed her teaching style and how she makes learning fun. Take her if you can!

This is a professor still in the field.  She teaches the real world and the text book together.  She is truly concerned about you actually learning the field than classroom work for a grade.   She loves "a healthy debate" for your grade which prepares you for defense attorneys.  Take her! She is entertaining and knows her stuff.

5 case briefs---grading was difficult to understand, also on exams. 4 exams--- wording is very tricky, wants you to pick the MOST correct answer, need to study!! attendance not mandatory, but recommended for notes. Final exam is comprehensive. She keeps class interesting with her comments and stories, she teaches DIRECTLY from the book!

Love her! She is very knowledgeable about Criminal Procedure, and provides many real-world examples. You will do about five case briefs, but they really enhance your learning if you take the time to to them. Her tests are very specific and tricky if you do not study.

Awesome class.  Instructor make the information clear and understandable.  Instructor is funny and bring real life scenarios to make the information plain to students. There are a lot of case briefs and work to do in the class.  No attendance, but if you show up and listen you can pass the test with a good grade.

Awesome teacher! She is very helpful and knowledgeable about the subject matter. She teaches directly out of the book, so if you ever had any issues, consulting the book always had the answer. She made the class interesting and I highly recommend her for any class!
If you ask for help, she will help you understand. The class is not easy. If you try you will do okay. Also sit in the front of class she likes that.

She has been my favorite professor so far. I took her for criminal procedure and found her to be interesting and beyond knowledgeable. She always has a real life example for the laws and procedures we discuss. Many people struggled in the class, but it is a HARD SUBJECT. I did my work, attended class, and ended the semester with a good grade.

Funny lady. Did not make students do dumb presentations or group work. Was an old school lecture and test type. Which I liked. She is very good at keeping the class alive and gives reviews. No paper for this class. You will do a lot of case briefs via webct though. I'd take her again. If she's open take her!
Very funny and smart professor. Tells you exactly what she wants and she always keeps the class interesting.
